etymologies: early 19th century: from French brome, from Greek brōmos ‘a stink’, + -ine

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 35, a dark red fuming toxic liquid with a choking, irritating smell. It is a member of the halogen group and occurs chiefly as salts in seawater and brines.
shortDefinitions: chemical element of atomic number 35, dark red fuming toxic liquid with choking
